references:
To enable fast aggregation with full device participation in vertical FL,
we shall propose an AirComp based Cloud-RAN to support vertical FL over ultra dense wireless networks, where multiple RRHs serving as edge servers are coordinated by a centralized BBU pool serving as a central server, as shown in Fig. 3.
In particular, the central server coordinates N𝑁N edge servers with limited-capacity digital fronthaul links to serve K𝐾K single-antenna devices.
Each edge server is equipped with M𝑀M antennas.
Let Cnsubscript𝐶𝑛C_{n} denote the fronthaul capacity of the link between edge server n𝑛n and the central server.
The fronthaul capacities need to satisfy an overall capacity constraint, i.e., ∑n=1NCn≤Csuperscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁subscript𝐶𝑛𝐶\sum_{n=1}^{N}C_{n}\leq C.
We assume perfect synchronization222
For the AirComp-based system, we can implement synchronization by sharing a reference-clock among the devices [38], or using the timing advance technique commonly adopted in 4G Long Term Evolution and 5G New Radio [39]. between among devices and perfect channel state information (CSI) between the edge servers to the devices is available to the central server and the devices333The RRHs estimates the channel state information (CSI) by receiving pilot signals sent from devices [40]..
The notations and parameters used in the system model are summarized in Table I.
In the following, we introduce the communication models for the uplink and downlink transmission to vertically train the FL model, respectively.
